sequence.notes: Robinson annulation of 2-methylcyclohexane-1,3-dione with ethyl vinyl ketone (EVK), forming a bicyclic enone-ketone system with a bridgehead methyl and specified stereochemistry.
Addition of lithium acetylide to a ketone, forming a tertiary alcohol and an alkyne.
Acetylation of tertiary alcohol and ketone (to form an enol acetate), accompanied by skeletal rearrangement and additional double bond formation.

Reactant undergoes acid-catalyzed rearrangement and elimination of one OAc group and transformation of the alkyne and other OAc group to form a bicyclic diketone with an acetyl group. The drawn product is a bicyclic compound (13 carbons), whereas 'Adrenosterone' is a tetracyclic steroid (19 carbons). The provided SMILES for the product was significantly incorrect; the corrected SMILES matches the drawn structure.

Selective protection of an alpha,beta-unsaturated ketone as a 1,3-dithiolane using ethane-1,2-dithiol, catalyzed by boron trifluoride diethyl etherate. The other alpha,beta-unsaturated acetyl group remains unchanged.

sequence.reaction_type: Silyl Enol Ether Formation / Intramolecular Silyl Protection
sequence.notes: Formation of a cyclic silyl ether by reaction of a ketone with a diol in the presence of Ph2SiCl2 and base. The ketone enolizes, and the diol's OH groups (one original, one from the enol) react with Ph2SiCl2 to form a cyclic silyl ether. Stereochemistry maintained for chiral centers and double bonds.
Intramolecular Diels-Alder reaction on a complex diene-dienophile system mediated by a chiral diphenylsilyl-protected diol auxiliary.

Deprotection of cyclic silylene acetal and oxidation/hydrolysis to form ketone and methyl ester. The silicon-containing protecting group is removed, and the lactone is opened and converted into a ketone at C16 and an additional methyl ester at C13, while retaining the C13 methyl group and the C17 alkene ester.
Magnesium-mediated 1,4-reduction of an alpha,beta-unsaturated methyl ester.

The Dieckmann cyclisation involves intramolecular condensation of two esters with elimination of methanol, forming a beta-keto ester. The product shown has two ketones and one ester, consistent with this reaction type. The new chiral center in the product bearing the methoxycarbonyl group is depicted with a wavy bond in the screenshot, indicating mixed stereochemistry. The original SMILES assigned a specific stereodescriptor; this has been corrected to reflect the unspecified stereochemistry.

Methyl ester at C16 is hydrolyzed to carboxylic acid, which then undergoes decarboxylation. The stereochemistry at C16, previously indicated by a wavy bond, becomes a simple CH2 group in the product. The ketone at C17 remains.
Mercury-mediated deprotection of a 1,3-dithiolane to a ketone, forming adrenosterone. The reaction represents one step in a 3-step sequence with an overall yield of 45%.
